notesStmt.note: Excision at outermost end, and a sewn repair suggesting strap attached at some time and pulled away.
Damp darkening along edges, plus a few tidemarks. Few usage stains.
Trimming has cut into edge. One small edge loss, and excessive trim in places.
A mezuzah, or door-phylactery, attached to the roll at the end (an extra membrane of 70 x 95mm attached at the inner end).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

layoutDesc.layout: Columns: 39; ruled lines: 11; written lines: 11; Uniform layout. Ruling by hard point, membrane by membrane. Visible pricking. No tagin on שעטנזגץ, and one on the letter ח of חור, 1:6. Minuscular letters entirely absent. The names of the sons of Haman arranged in 11 lines, in accordance with the rule. Sections 6:1 and 7:5 open. Some erasures.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi square script of the 17th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Sir Hans Sloane: baronet, physician and collector (b. 1660, d. 1753): in his collection; acquired by the British Museum in 1753.
